net.cloud.gfx.elements

Class Text

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.elements.AbstractElement
      • net.cloud.gfx.elements.Text
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Element, Focusable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CenteredText, ReferenceText

    public class Text
extends AbstractElement
    Analogous to the JLabel. Used to display some text string on the screen. Supports changing the font and color. The position is the top left, like everything else.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Text

        public Text(java.lang.String text)
        Create a new text label. It will use the default font and color. It will use the default priority and be at 0,0
        Parameters:
        text - The text to show

      • Text

        public Text(java.lang.String text,
            int x,
            int y)
        Create a new text label with default color and font. It will use the default priority but the top left corner will be at the given position
        Parameters:
        text - The text
        x - The x-position. The left edge of the text
        y - The y-position. The top edge of the text

      • Text

        public Text(java.lang.String text,
            int priority,
            int x,
            int y,
            java.awt.Font font,
            java.awt.Color color)
        Create a new text label with the given attributes
        Parameters:
        text - The text
        priority - The z-priority
        x - The x-position. The left edge of the text
        y - The y-position. The top edge of the text
        font - The font. Check the Fonts enum for values.
        color - The color. Check the Colors enum for values.

    • Method Detail

      • drawElement

        public void drawElement(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        int offsetX,
                        int offsetY)
                 throws IteratorException
        Draw the text in the desired font and color at the position. The text will be drawn by the top left corner, rather than baseline.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object to draw to
        offsetX - How far off on the X axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        offsetY - How far off on the Y axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        Throws:
        IteratorException - If there was an issue iterating child elements

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns:
        The text in this Text

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Set this element to show some different text
        Parameters:
        text - The new text to show

      • getFont

        public java.awt.Font getFont()
        Returns:
        The Font object being used to draw this text

      • setFont

        public void setFont(java.awt.Font font)
        Change the Font in order to change how the text appears. For some constants, see Fonts
        Parameters:
        font - The new Font object

      • setFontSize

        public void setFontSize(int size)
        Change the size of the font in order to change how the text appears
        Parameters:
        size - The new size of the text, in typical point fashion

      • setFontStyle

        public void setFontStyle(int style)
        Change the style of the font in order to change how the text appears
        Parameters:
        style - The style constant - see Font

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor()
        Returns:
        The Color of the text

      • setColor

        public void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Set the color the the text will appear. For some values, see Colors
        Parameters:

      • updateGlyphVector

        protected void updateGlyphVector(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
        Update the glyph vector if need be, so the text is updated.
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object currently being used to draw with

      • updateTextMetrics

        protected void updateTextMetrics(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Calculate and assign the text height and element height of this text label. The element's width is also determined. This is necessary to draw in the right position, and must be done if the font or text changes. When this is called, action will only be taken if the update flag is set. The flag will be cleared.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object this text is being drawn to
